p: Similarly, climate change is expected to shift agricultural production and potential. In some areas climate change is expected to make conditions more favorable for meeting growing demands on ecosystems and cultivated systems; in other regions conditions are expected to worsen, making it difficult for ecosystems to meet human needs [ 17– 19]. Reductions in productivity in one region may increase demand in other regions where productivity has benefited from climate change [ 13]. When technological advancement and agricultural intensification are insufficient to meet demand, agricultural expansion is a major source of land use and land cover change and conversion [ 20– 22].
